title: Aristotle - The father of modern scientific thought
description:
Even thought I do not agree in all areas with Aristotle, he was deninitely one of the greatest metaphysical minds the world has seen.


"THE investigation of the truth is in one way hard, in another easy. An indication of this is found in the fact that no one is able to attain the truth adequately, while, on the other hand, we do not collectively fail, but every one says something true about the nature of things, and while individually we contribute little or nothing to the truth, by the union of all a considerable amount is amassed." -- Aristotle, Metaphisics
